description: standing female figure with heavy feet wearing a helmet-shaped hat and shirt, both patterned with carved rows of triangles; bent elbows and hands on stomach; attached to wood mount
dimension: 9 1/4 x 2 11/16 x 2 1/4 in. (23.5 x 6.8 x 5.7 cm) (without mount)
markings: \'PANGOLIN/CHOKWE/KERR\', in black marker, on bottom of mount
text: The triangular patterns on the hat and torso of this figure refer symbolically to the protective scales of the pangolin, a small African mammal.  Pangolins are associated with the ancestors in Chokwe society because they burrow into termite mounds, considered thresholds between the world of spirits and humans.
title: Figure
